drug.name: Antazoline
drug.description: Antazoline is a 1st generation antihistamine with anticholinergic activity. It is used to relieve nasal congestion. It is also formulated as eye drops with naphazoline to relieve allergic conjunctivitis.

article.citation: Figus M, Fogagnolo P, Lazzeri S, Capizzi F, Romagnoli M, Canovetti A, Iester M, Ferreras A, Rossetti L, Nardi M: Treatment of allergic conjunctivitis: results of a 1-month, single-masked randomized study. Eur J Ophthalmol. 2010 Sep-Oct;20(5):811-8.

drug.synthesis-reference: Miescher, K. and Klarer, W.; US. Patent 2,449,241; September 14,1948: assigned to Ciba Pharmaceutical Products, Inc.
drug.indication: Used to relieve nasal congestion and in eye drops, usually in combination with naphazoline, to relieve the symptoms of allergic conjunctivitis.
drug.pharmacodynamics: Antazoline is a histamine H1 receptor antagonist. It selectively bind to but does not activate histamine H1 receptors, thereby blocking the actions of endogenous histamine.
drug.mechanism-of-action: Antazoline binds to the histamine H1 receptor. This blocks the action of endogenous histamine, which subsequently leads to temporary relief of the negative symptoms brought on by histamine.

classification.description: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as phenylbenzamines. These are aromatic compounds consisting of a benzyl group that is N-linked to a benzamine.

mixture.name: Nestabs ONE
mixture.ingredients: Antazoline + Calcium ascorbate + Cholecalciferol + Cyanocobalamin + Folic acid + Iron + Magnesium oxide + Pyridoxine + Tocopherol + Zinc oxide

atc-code.level: DECONGESTANTS AND OTHER NASAL PREPARATIONS FOR TOPICAL USE

drug-interaction.name: Ivabradine
drug-interaction.description: Ivabradine may increase the QTc-prolonging activities of Antazoline.

drug-interaction.name: Benzylpenicilloyl polylysine
drug-interaction.description: Antazoline may decrease effectiveness of Benzylpenicilloyl polylysine as a diagnostic agent.

drug-interaction.name: Betahistine
drug-interaction.description: The therapeutic efficacy of Betahistine can be decreased when used in combination with Antazoline.

drug-interaction.name: Hyaluronidase (ovine)
drug-interaction.description: The therapeutic efficacy of Hyaluronidase (ovine) can be decreased when used in combination with Antazoline.

drug-interaction.name: Amphetamine
drug-interaction.description: Amphetamine may decrease the sedative and stimulatory activities of Antazoline.

property.source: Miescher, K. and Klarer, W.; US. Patent 2,449,241; September 14,1948: assigned to Ciba Pharmaceutical Products, Inc.

article.citation: Swiader MJ, Luszczki JJ, Wielosz M, Czuczwar SJ: Effect of histamine receptor antagonists on aminophylline-induced seizures and lethality in mice. Pharmacol Rep. 2005 Jul-Aug;57(4):531-5.

polypeptide.name: Histamine H1 receptor
polypeptide.specific-function: In peripheral tissues, the H1 subclass of histamine receptors mediates the contraction of smooth muscles, increase in capillary permeability due to contraction of terminal venules, and catecholamine release from adrenal medulla, as well as mediating neurotransmission in the central nervous system.

go-classifier.description: phospholipase C-activating G-protein coupled receptor signaling pathway
positive regulation of inositol trisphosphate biosynthetic process
